title: Conflict Resolution & Constructive Feedback
description: Vocabulary for mediation, consensus building, and mixed conditionals for analyzing office dynamics.

items.explanation: To de-escalate means to reduce the intensity or severity of a conflict.
items.prompt: Which term describes the act of reducing the intensity of a workplace conflict?

items.explanation: Mixed Conditional (Past Action -> Present Result): If + Past Perfect, would + bare infinitive.
items.prompt: If the manager ________ (address) the tension in the team last month, we ________ (not / face) this stalemate today.
answers: had addressed / would not be facing

items.explanation: A grievance is a formal complaint raised by an employee.
items.prompt: What is the formal term for a complaint raised by an employee regarding their treatment?

items.explanation: Mixed Conditional (Present Condition -> Past Result): If + Past Simple, would have + past participle.
items.prompt: If he ________ (be) more open to feedback, he ________ (not / react) so defensively during the performance review yesterday.

items.explanation: A stalemate is a situation where no progress or agreement can be reached.
items.prompt: Which phrase indicates that a negotiation has stopped because neither side will give in?

items.explanation: 'Common ground' refers to shared interests or points of agreement.
items.prompt: Despite their differences, the two departments managed to find some ________ ________ regarding the new office policy.

options: "I feel that communication could be clearer."
items.explanation: Diplomatic language uses 'I' statements and focuses on neutral, objective observations.
items.prompt: Which of the following is an example of diplomatic, non-accusatory feedback?

items.explanation: Radical Candor involves challenging directly while caring personally.
items.prompt: According to the Radical Candor framework, feedback is most effective when you challenge someone ________ while caring ________.

items.explanation: Mediation is the process where a neutral third party helps resolve a dispute.
items.prompt: When two employees cannot resolve a conflict themselves, HR might step in to provide ________.
If we want to settle this dispute, both sides will need to ________ ________.
